website_summaries.verdict: A simple wire cheese slicer in a generous size.
pros: Attractive, modern design with a base made out of two-tone bamboo
At 12" x 6", it is big enough to hold a full block of cheese
The cutting wire is stainless steel, making it durable and sharp
The wire also has a lifetime warranty against breaking
cons: The cutting arm can get to be off-center and needs to be readjusted

customer_reviews.title: The wire is adjustable, don't listen to the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously people cannot read the instructions for setting the wire so it lines up in the groove. One reviewer actually took a picture of a misaligned wire and in the same picture a piece of paper that reads: "Your cheese slicer may arrive with the cutting wire not lined up properly with cutting slot. This situation is easily correct by gently working the bar further out from the hole in the board until wire is aligned with slot." Then it even gives you a picture. It's easy, pull the bar out, problem solved, don't be an ignorant idiot and waste money returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: USMCSurvivalist85

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for soap!
customer_reviews.text: I'm way too cheap to spend 140$ on a soap cutter, this is so super perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lynn Craig

customer_reviews.title: This looked pretty cool when I checked it out prior to ordering
customer_reviews.text: This looked pretty cool when I checked it out prior to ordering. After having used it for 3 weeks or so, I can't recommend it for cutting cheese (despite the glowing reviews of the soapers). You do need to align the wire with the slot—OK, no problem. The issue is that the handle is too loose to keep a straight cut down through the cheese resulting in slices that are inevitably thicker on top or bottom. Of course, making fine adjustments after cutting off a couple of preliminary slices (or should I say wedges?) results in misalignment of the cutting wire with the groove. There seems to be no way to make consistently uniform slices with parallel sides.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It makes slicing cheese so much easier. I have a pretty good knife that I was using to slice of cheese. But, it doesn't hold a candle to this cheese slicer. It is nearly effortless to cut the cheese! ( not the stinky kind 😉 ) If the wire doesn't seem to line up, it is a very simple fix. You just pull the slicing arm in or out to line it up. Simple simple simple! The instructions clearly state that it might need adjusted! I think this thing is awesome! I would not hesitate to buy again if I needed a good cheese slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Carl Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Great for Slicing Soap!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a soap maker but can't afford one of those massive multislice cutters. I bought this and it works beautifully. Even straight lines every time (I marked off the width I wanted with some masking tape and just line it up with that). If It can slice through a bar of soap, I'm sure it can cut cheese beautifully too!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Guptill

customer_reviews.title: Just used it a second time and did much better after knowing that little quirk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for slicing soap and for the most part it does the job extremely well. My only complaint is that the arm that the wire is attached to isn’t stable so it does create wavy lines down the cut if I’m not paying attention. Lesson learned on the first loaf I cut with it. Just used it a second time and did much better after knowing that little quirk. I think it would work fantastic for cheese!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Good Slicer Once Wire is Straight
customer_reviews.text: The slicer looks just like the picture and seems to be well built, except for the arm with the wire which was off center so the wire could not cut. After reading the instructions about this issue (which come with the slicer), with some careful maneuvering, I bent the arm and the wire now slides into the groove. I like this type of cheese slicer - nice clean cuts.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased to cut soap to help with making uniform cuts. However I decided to try to cut cheese with it (as it's intended) and it doesn't cut straight (in up down regards). If it can't cut cheese how is it supposed to cut soap evenly? Ends up with a narrow top and a fat bottom or vice versa. I was planning on placing a stopper block so I could cut soap at consistent sizes but I don't have high hopes for any consistency even with a stop block. I may still give it a try, soap is a different consistency than Tillamoock Cheddar. I'll update my review if anything improves.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K. Marder

customer_reviews.title: Much easier than using an electric knife!
customer_reviews.text: This cheese slicer is great! I have a medical condition which requires me to eat a lot of cheese (sounds great, right?) This is one of the few Amazon products that's EXACTLY as advertised. I do have some notes to help you: 1) The video is correct - the blade ships with the end slightly mis-aligned. However, just follow the instructions to re-align it. 2) When cutting thru cheese, the handle makes a slight "clacking" sound when you're finished slicing. However, this doesn't seem to affect the performance. 3) Easy to clean - I just use a wet paper towel. Happy slicing!
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Overall very disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the photo my cheese board is not holding up very well. I clean it with warm soapy water every time I use it, dry it completely and put it up. Over time, which again has only been a few months, its peeling and fading. Weird. Anyway, looking at other options, brands and will throw this one out. Don't waste your money on this one, keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got this today. Pretty disappointed that when you close the handle down to cut, it does not drop nicely into the slot that is cut into the board. If you pull it pretty hard to the right, it will fall into the groove. I think a basic QA effort may have discovered this before it was shipped to me. I'm going to keep it because I can make it work. Just think it could be made a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This product came to delivered to me with a defect or a design flaw either way its been rendered useless the problem is the cutting wire does not line up with the cut out on the board that the wire lays into so when you push down to slice the wire misses the trench and doesnt cut the piece completely forcing you to tear the edge and that then defeats the purpose of owning one of these
customer_reviews.author: petermerc711

customer_reviews.title: More cheese, please!
customer_reviews.text: This product has only accelerated the consumption of cheese in my household. 5/5 use 5/5 quality 1/5 have to buy more cheese! (okay, 5/5). If you are sick of messing up your cheese for grilled cheese or ham sammiches, this is for you! Makes slicing cheese so much easier. Slicer is easy to use, easy to clean, and a hit with the cheese consumers in the house. Can't go wrong with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than it looks. Bought this for an island trip and was hoping the bamboo would be light weight to carry in my luggage. Ended up taking it any ways not knowing if the VRBO would supply a cheese slicer. I would recommend this for a gift and just so you know you can purchase extra wires on line because they don’t last forever.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as my older Prodyne Cheese Slicer
customer_reviews.text: Received an email from seller advising that the slicer's wire cutter might need to be better aligned before using. When it arrived the wire bar was so loose that the wire moved every time a slice of cheese was accomplished. I can't really remedy this problem so I have been very careful to visually align the cutter with the groove each time I use it. Would have sent it back but needed it right away. Also would purchase just the wire replacement for my older slicer but it is not offered without the entire wire assembly and cutting arm.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than using a knife
customer_reviews.text: Works great, have not had to replace the wire yet. I would like the device to be more sturdier...Cheese gets into the cutting groove and I am concerned the wire might rust with moisture or getting too wet. So, I hand clean it and wipe it dry. I wouldn't attempt to place this slicer in the dishwasher. I would like to see if they could modify the device or come up with a way to give the user greater access to clean out that cutting groove. I am still impressed with the ease of use and it does what it says, so I give it an overall 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cheese Cutting Board
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and it was received happily. I witnessed someone's cheese cutter die just before their birthday, so I was in luck for ideas. I purchased this one because the steel top was attractive and matched their kitchen. He used it the day I gave it to him and after a bit of adjusting with the wire, it worked great. He was pretty happy about it and it was an upgrade from a regular cutter to the cutting board. Recommended as a gift. It is quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Good for cutting soap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cutting homemade soap, and it does the job nicely. It makes nice, smooth cuts right where I want them. I never even knew a cheese cutter was a thing until I got into soapmaking, so I can't really compare it to others, but it seems like it would cut through cheese easily. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and looks pretty fancy with the nice wood base. I'd buy this one again if I needed one, but it seems like this one will hold up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: poor quality don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Cut well for maybe a month then the wire was so stretched and bent due to the tension of cutting (isn't that what its made for?) it wouldn't adjust or re-tension. The wood board also began to split like it didn't like being hand washed in hot soapy water... I'm not content to just wipe down a cheese board - surely it should be robust enough to be hand washed? Nice gimmick, the kids liked it for a month but then its unusable and I can't work out a way to return it beyond the 30 day amazon policy.
customer_reviews.author: elsie

customer_reviews.title: Peeling laminate after only 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Not even 2 weeks old and the laminate on the wood is already peeling off. It's been hand washed 3 times with regular dish soap. Nothing corrosive. Why is there laminate anyway? I was already unimpressed with this unit. Way too easy to make uneven cuts. Thickness from the top of the cut was never even with the bottom. Wire would drift to the outside and sometimes come out of the side of the cheese before you got to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Makes Cutting Cheese Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Simple design and very easy to use. We have been using knives to cut the cheese with uneven slices. Made minor adjustment to correct the wire alignment and was able to cut a cheese slab in a few minutes! See the video review!
customer_reviews.author: Folsom DIY Fan

customer_reviews.title: Nice to use but worrisome to clean
customer_reviews.text: I buy blocks of cheese and cut them into cubes, it's a cheaper alternative to buying cubed cheese to snack on. This makes it easy and quick. It's not the nicest to clean though. Cheese will get stuck in the crack where the wire goes and I don't like running the board under water because it doesn't dry in the crack very well. So I'm uncertain how sanitary this is but it does make cutting cheese easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Draves

customer_reviews.title: For cheese, yes! For soap, ehh, naw.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to soap making and realized that cutting even soaps by free hand is more difficult than u could imagine. So I opted for this option. Though the wire will cut through your soap, it did not allow me to get even bars. You will need both hands to maneuver hold the loaf down/in place and then pulling the hand to slice while ensuring the bar doesn't slide off the base....
customer_reviews.author: rushane b.

customer_reviews.title: Great soap slicer!!
customer_reviews.text: I looked into soap slicers and was just not ready to put down a couple of hundred of dollars. This cheese slicer slices my soap beautifully & I like that the company added the info on how to purchase a replacement wire on the bottom of the slicer. I’m sure it works great for cheese too, because it handles soap really well. Great price too! Also, just read how to line up the wire when you take it out of the box. You should not have a problem after that.
customer_reviews.author: Y R

customer_reviews.title: Makes cutting soap easier
customer_reviews.text: This cheese slicer works great for cutting blocks of soap. I was slicing soap with a knife but could not get even slices. With this I do and it didn’t cost arm & a leg. As for the durability I really can’t say because I haven’t had it long enough. All in all I’m happy with My purchase. I do have to say that this was not my idea, I read where someone else purchased this slicer to cut soap & it worked for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. High quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love my cheese slicer. I use it to cut soap. Modified it slightly so the soap stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: jenv

customer_reviews.title: Great cheese slicer
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase. Can get slices really thin. Never realized what we were missing out on having a board attached to our previous cheese slicer that broke. Have to be mindful of cleaning out the groove where cheese particles can accumulate. A small wire brush does the trick to keep clean
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Why did I ever use a knife?
customer_reviews.text: I really love this board!! First off it says it isnt dishwasher safe, but I have used it in the dishwasher. I cant say it's the best idea, but so far it's still holding up. I cant believe I went years without it. This slices cheese as thin or thick as you want it. Small or large pieces. So easy to use, and far FAR easier than a knife. We have already bought another for a friend and they love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Overall I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: I keep this near since we eat a lot of cheese. Overall I really like this product, but as it states, the wire may have to be adjusted when you receive it. I adjusted it, and have found that after several uses, I had to adjust it again. Cuts great, glad I bought it......better than using a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for a cheese cutter
customer_reviews.text: This is not worth the money. The wire doesn't fit into the "groove" cut for it. It won't go all the way through the cheese. The wire is not thin enough or sharp enough to cut through easily either. We donated it and bought a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy to cut soap.
customer_reviews.text: As a new soaper with a limited budget this is one of my first mistakes, buying this to cut my loafs of soap into bars. The loaf slips and it took two of us to get the cuts straight. I used this until we were able to get something else. Not the fault of this item. It cuts great and the wire is strong.
customer_reviews.author: MadamButtrfli

customer_reviews.title: Great cheese slicer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for years and I am giving some for gifts this holiday. This particular slicer has an extra strong wire and goes through cheese blocks with no problem. I have compared other slicers and the wires are very thin. You can order extra wires for $1.50. I have an extra one on the bottom of my slicer and have never had to use it! I highly recommend this slicer!
customer_reviews.author: dancingduchess

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I got to cut soap, it works well for that but not for tall soap. If the soap is 3.5 inches or less then it will work fine but taller would require something different. Also the loaf would need to be stablized so it doesn't slide or move if looking for exact and precise cuts
customer_reviews.author: Kasara

customer_reviews.title: Very good cheese cutting board
customer_reviews.text: The one star was removed for having to adjust the cutting wire so it aligns with the board's slot. This has been mentioned in other reviews. The instructs do provide contact information for replacement wire. $1 each plus shipping. I recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce R.

customer_reviews.title: Lovely and well sized
customer_reviews.text: I love the bamboo wood grain, very good quality, aesthetic and easy to clean. I was a little bummed that the handle piece was silver plastic instead of silver metal as that was the part that broke down on my previous one. But knowing that we'll be nicer to this one :)
customer_reviews.author: S. Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Cheese with ease
customer_reviews.text: My friends got a cheese slicer things as a gift and I LOVED using it. It made cutting blocks of cheese faster and easier. So I order this one off Amazon. Prodyne 805B beechwood cheese slicer and I love it. It works well, and is easier enough to hand wash.
customer_reviews.author: Kammeron

customer_reviews.title: Great little cheese slicer
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of cheese, so naturally I wanted a cheese slicer so I could thinly slice my cheese & enjoy as a little snack. This little ditty did not disappoint. It’s sliced my cheese wonderfully & I have been washing it gently by hand and letting it air dry.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great slicer
customer_reviews.text: My dad had one of these and I thought it was the best thing since sliced bread! So of course I had to go buy one and I'm glad I did. It works great, slices thick and thin, and has never snapped a wire (and I've had it more than a year now). Works best on cheeses like cheddar. It's easy to adjust the position of the wire by bumping the arm. It's easy to clean, I just run a toothbrush down the groove if anything sticks. I like that there is a sticker on the bottom with instructions for buying replacement wires, who keeps instructions for things like this!
customer_reviews.author: Judi W

customer_reviews.title: Finally a Cheese Slicer that Won't Break
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through cheese slicers at a rate of two a year for decades. This cheese slicer works great, is easy to maintain and shows no signs of any wear and tear even though I have been using it daily for six months. The hand held models are fine but always snap and break. No problems after six months with this model.
customer_reviews.author: palral

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have been very pleased with this cheese slicer. Cleaning the groove and wire are a bit difficult, but no harder than other models we owned. Life time guarantee on the wire is nice but realistically not much of an option. Who keeps the paperwork years after purchasing one of these cutters to be able to reorder another? Information printed on the bottom of the cutter would be a better idea. Easily burned into the wood base, it would be there forever.
customer_reviews.author: JackB

customer_reviews.title: Saved time getting cheese's ready for 🧀 board🥰
customer_reviews.text: Perfect with using for our Thanksgiving dinner cheese board!! Actually would be a nice giftable item👍 Would recommend 😊 Side note: My teenage son used it to get cheese's ready for cheese board 😁 Made getting help in prepping much easier 👍
customer_reviews.author: Just Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Damage more than half!
customer_reviews.text: Way more than a dint or stain , more than half of unit was damaged. The wire spring/wrapping cuts into product. Totally was Not acceptable for resell. More hassle to return than to keep. It did arrive fast and use is limited, not completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: A. OReilly

customer_reviews.title: Use it for soap cutting
customer_reviews.text: It is not the most sturdy thing to cut soap with as you have to really focus on holding it down as straight as possible even with the cable being slightly off angle, but it does cut smooth and level holding it appropriately! Its price is amazing and worth some ease compared to cutting it completely free hand
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this butcher block cutting board. It’s a little smaller than I expected and very lightweight but for the price it is very functional and looks good. It just arrived today and I’ve already used and washed it twice. I good forward to using it again this weekend when we have guests over for happy hour.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Great cheese cutter
customer_reviews.text: We use the cutter all the time. We like it so much I bought two kits and made my own to give as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: mario gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Use: as a soap cutter, not a cheese ...
customer_reviews.text: Use: as a soap cutter, not a cheese cutter! It works as a soap cutter, but keep in mind the soap with move around as you cut so the bars sometimes go diagonal. I guess you would have the same issue if you were cutting a large block of cheese and you care about uniformity.
customer_reviews.author: K Time

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, the arm/wire was a little off and didn't fit properly into the slot when cutting down but the device came with instructions for that specific issue. Also gives instructions on how to buy replacement wire.
customer_reviews.author: Juicy J

customer_reviews.title: Small in size and thin cutting wire
customer_reviews.text: The handle that the wire attaches too is plastic, even though it looks like pewter. Wire is smaller diameter than I would prefer. Did cut some harder cheese but was concerning because the wire was deflecting so much.
customer_reviews.author: J Holder

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I had hoped. REALLY hard to make thin slices with this. Great for thick slices like for a party tray. Now I'm looking for a better cheese slicer and this is stored under the kitchen counter for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walker

customer_reviews.title: Slices my soaps nice and clean
customer_reviews.text: Slices my soaps nice and clean. But the wire is at an angle despite trying to adjust it. Other reviewers had said the same. It's manageable but annoying
customer_reviews.author: Maverick Pearl

customer_reviews.title: It’s an okay purchase depending on needs.
customer_reviews.text: The cut is fine, but the wire is not properly aligned. If I cut straight, the wire will meet the wood rather than line up with the indent. I have to pull to the right HARD and even then it doesn’t always line up properly. Outside of desiring straight pieces, this is also frustrating because this means the cut isn’t always complete. I’ve already used several times, so don’t want to return. But I’ll probably be upgrading sooner than later.
customer_reviews.author: Niks

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT get for soap. Too small.
customer_reviews.text: Total crap. Cheap and cuts ragged. Got for soap and I guess if you held the soap in a death grip it might work. Do not get off you want to cut soap loaves or really anything bigger than a small piece of cheese. Also the wire is wrapped crappy and will leave marks.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie A

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cheese slicer that can do oh so much more!
customer_reviews.text: I very much enjoy this cheese slicer, and when the dreadful day comes that it's just plain tuckered out I will get the same one so long as it's available. It even does a really good job with firmer cheeses, although it does need to be taken apart a bit every once in a while to get all the nooks and crannies cleaned out properly. It's kinda scary where cheese can get to!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea ONeel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cutting cheese as well as soap.
customer_reviews.text: I own my own soap business. I use this to cut the bars to my proper thickness. I cut 4" x 4" blocks of soap with ease. The wood is very nice looking. I love this item. I see no Cons to the item.
customer_reviews.author: Brad P

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This product works pretty good but the cheese gets stuck in the crack. This is the first time I have owned one of these and maybe that’s how they all are. Just doesn’t seem like the crack gets cleaned very well when you clean it as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So happy to find this one
customer_reviews.text: For years I used this same cheese slicer in Taiwan. When I moved back to the US, I didn't take it with me. I wanted a similar one and was tickled to find the identical product on Amazon. Really excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Mala Qiu

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel line does need to be kept clean but the accuracy in cutting is great. the groove in the wood I just tap ...
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day for lunch. Cheese & crackers! some jelly on top. yum yum. The stainless steel line does need to be kept clean but the accuracy in cutting is great. the groove in the wood I just tap the board on the table and all cheese mess falls out. I've had mine for some time and it still cuts through cheese with ease.
customer_reviews.author: smiley face

customer_reviews.title: Not great for soap
customer_reviews.text: Got this to cut my cold process soap. The small wire wrap at the bottom can cut into the soap and it's difficult to hold the loaf straight while cutting. It cuts pretty well though--nice and clean. I think I'll splurge on a wire cutter with guide blocks though.
customer_reviews.author: HunterMG

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a little while now. So far so good, it's worked flawlessly for us and it gets daily use. I did have to adjust the cutting wire when it arrived but that was easy enough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cheese Slicer
customer_reviews.text: This butcher block slicer works great. In retrospect, I should have bought the polypropylene style to facilitate cleanup. I don't like submersing the wooden one in water, but the plastic one would be an improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to slice cheese. It’s very efficient, and I can slice to any thickness desired. When I received it there were instructions on how to adjust the wire which were very easy to follow. It also came with info on where to obtain additional wires.
customer_reviews.author: JanPT

customer_reviews.title: What’s not to like?
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a quality cheese slicer. I love that this isn’t s heavy piece, marble is nice but sometimes I don’t like the heaviness of it. This is heavy enough that it doesn’t slide all over the place when slicing but lightweight enough it doesn’t feel like a brick. I recommend this model
customer_reviews.author: Poodlelicious81

customer_reviews.title: Soapers, use for your CP. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Great for soaping. I got a little over-zealous with a harder bar and stretched the wires, which are not available here on amazon, so it seems. So it is kind of a PITA to get new wires. Think I will be investing in a prof cutter, but for those looking for a quick start, this is a great option. Cut your bars before they get too hard. Don't use for M&P. Only CP
customer_reviews.author: radarluv

customer_reviews.title: Sharp cutter
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts regarding all cheese cutters because none of them was sharp enough to cut cheese, but with this cutter I was surprised. It cuts cheese (Monterey Jack) so easy without any pressure. I used it only twice and so far I like it very much. Hope it will serve long enough.
customer_reviews.author: kristine

customer_reviews.title: 4yo managed to snap the handle
customer_reviews.text: We loved this for 10 months because it let our children slice their own cheese from smaller chunks. Tonight, my 4yo was slicing soft cheddar, and she put pressure on the front of the handle and the whole thing snapped. Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Marla Singer

customer_reviews.title: Very good cheese cutter
customer_reviews.text: I was concern about reviews that the wire was not line up. After watching the video, I know how to align it correctly. It cut cheese perfectly. This is a must have cheese cutting board.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Cleans easily, I thought I would love the metal surface ...
customer_reviews.text: Cleans easily, I thought I would love the metal surface but other than cleaning, it actually makes slicing a little more difficult as the cold cheese "sticks" to it and doesn't slide easily. I normally cut up cheese for crackers and I usually do so with these boards at a pretty fast pace, and this one has definitely slowed me down a bit. Other than that, it looks nice, has options for replacement wire, and cleans up easy.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. Use this on just about a daily basis. Cuts to the thickness of the cheese perfectly. I’ve even used it to cut summer sausage with no problems. Super easy to clean and seems to be very durable. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: sabrina harrell

customer_reviews.title: very nice for cutting soap!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend $100 in a soap cutter so l tried this cheese slicer and i am very happy with it. I even managed to cut a 4lbs loaf, I guess it is not as easy with a real soap cutter but it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Estegal

customer_reviews.title: Yikes
customer_reviews.text: I am going to give this 2 stars and the only reason it's getting that is because its easy to clean off. The wire and handle are filmy trash. The wire literally bent trying to slice a block of cheddar.
customer_reviews.author: Gia

customer_reviews.title: Gunk gets caught in the crack
customer_reviews.text: This thing has a cool design and makes cutting cheese safer and easier, but it's too hard to clean and the unsealed wood is asking for mold unless it's carefully dried after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Prime4Value

customer_reviews.title: Wire Wont Adjust
customer_reviews.text: So I actually bought this item to cut my soap loaves and it works pretty great for that. The only reason I’m not giving it five stars is because the wire doesn’t go into the little slot like it’s supposed to. It’s crooked and goes onto the wood part beside the slot. It cuts my soaps a little crooked. I’ve tried to fix it, but the wire won’t tighten no matter how hard I try. I can’t even get the screw loose to loosen it. I still using it, but I have to pull to the side a little while going down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: the best cheese slicer and it also can be used for many other things as cutting bar soaps, but i suggest you buy a second one only for that, once the soaps smells perfume, it is not good cut food on the same slicer.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Wire Misses Groove
customer_reviews.text: I love cheese and love the idea of how easy this makes it to cut the cheese, pun intended. The one problem I have is that sometimes when bringing down the wire, it doesn't always go into the groove. I have tried making little adjustments, but nothing has helped. The product still works great, but that one little issue is enough to bug.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and perfect for soap cutting
customer_reviews.text: I use this cutter for cutting soap. It works perfectly and is very sturdy and durable. Would recommend for any soap maker who needs a cutter but doesn't want to spend a ton of money on soap-specific tools.
customer_reviews.author: Keri K

customer_reviews.title: slices cheese like a breeze!
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A VERY NICE CHEESE BOARD AND SLICER...NO MORE JAGGERED EDGES...A SMOOTH CUT EVERY TIME WHETHER THICK OR THIN. VERY PLEASED WITH MINE AND HAPPY I BOUGHT IT...FIVE STARS!!
customer_reviews.author: fred bonn

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be aligned to cut straight
customer_reviews.text: You cannot cut straight slices. The hole in the cutting board the cutting arm fits in is way too large for the arm. The arm wobbles in the hole. The cutting wire this has so much side to side play you can’t cut straight. The alignment other reviews refer to cannot be achieved since the shaft is so loose in the hole. Shaft is supposed to be tight.
customer_reviews.author: 3 Tunes

customer_reviews.title: good cheese cutter
customer_reviews.text: i make cheese at home and this cheese cutter works great for slicing thin slices. so much easier and more effective than using a knife. appears to be sturdy and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I used a wood burner, and wrote my boyfriend's initials in it. He loves it. The wire can bend, or get caught up in the groove a bit, but other than that it's great. One time my bf sent me a pic of the cheese tray fully loaded, just because he was so excited that the tray was the perfect size for a individual pack of Ritz. It's the small things in life people.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Best wire cheese slicer I've found
customer_reviews.text: These wire cheese silvers are a wonderful way to serve cheese. The trick is to get one whose wire does not break. The design and construction of this slicer is very solid. It has a lifetime guarantee on the wire, but I am expecting never to need a replacement, it is so well made. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t Be Happier...Gonna Go Cut Me Some Cheese!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t listen to the bad reviews, as the top reviewer said. A quick look at the instructions and adjusting the cutting wire is done. My came securely packed and in perfect condition. The wire was a wee-bit out of position, but as the instructions say, it’s possible that could happen, and easy to correct. Overall I’m very happy with my purchase. But ‘nuff said, I’m gonna go cut me some more cheese!
customer_reviews.author: FishingFool

customer_reviews.title: Misplaced Wire
customer_reviews.text: The wire portion is not lined up flush with the groove in the board, making it slightly difficult to get a uniform cut on the cheese. Other than that, it's reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: misssummerrose

customer_reviews.title: Great looking cheese slices
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to use cheese slicer. It cut everything uniformly even and made it look professional. You have to experiment with the width of each slice and then it's easy. They give you really good instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Deegan-Adams

customer_reviews.title: Makes slicing cheese quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cheese slicer as an attempt to save money by slicing my own cheeses instead of buying the slice trays. It has met this goal perfectly. I am able to quickly slice very thin slices. I can slice a 16 oz block of cheese in just a couple of minutes. it is 4 stars instead of 5 because the wire naturally comes down and hits the upper part of the block. To have the wire go into the slicing notch I have to pull it to the right- not terribly difficult but not ideal either.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Very wobbly, but it will cut cheese
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to cut a straight line. I used for cheese and soap. It will cut, but the bars easily slide around. The wire also moves left and right very easily. Then it is hard to clean the line in the wood where the wire closes into.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great, a little crooked
customer_reviews.text: The wire did not line up in the cut out part of the board too well on the handle end (last part to slice). I did run a sharp knife in the groove to widen it a bit, but this takes away from the finish that is put on the board. The wire and mechanism work great, they are just a little misaligned. This also causes the cheese to be cut a little crooked. normally you would be able to line the cheese up with the squares on the board for the straight cuts, but this isn't possible because of the misalignment.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Just do it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Wish I’d gotten it years ago! It slices easily. I use it several times a week and have had no issues. Much more fun to use and clean than a crater! #knucklesaver
customer_reviews.author: LEONARD P GRIM

customer_reviews.title: Finally a well built cheese slicer
customer_reviews.text: Finally a well built cheese slicer. A very taught wire with excellent end connections. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Metro Nine

customer_reviews.title: Not for soapers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an inexpensive alternative to real cutters for cold/hot process soap based on reviews. There is no way to get a straight cut. Once taken out of the initial safety position, it's clear to see that the wire is strung at an odd angle, which doesn't align in any way to the rest of the machine and creates haphazard, diagonal cuts. That, coupled with a lack of stabilization on the board, made this pointless for precise soap cutting.
customer_reviews.author: debra stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works great for cold process soap cutting
customer_reviews.text: I use this to cut cold process soap, it’s changed my soap cutting completely. Straight cuts, no drag lines, wonderful! Great low price solution for getting crisp bars of soap.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Thear

customer_reviews.title: A valid reason for not buying this thing
customer_reviews.text: Just threw this slicer into the trash bin. It’s neither good, nor bad - just average. The wire stretched pretty quickly (didn’t use it very often), but getting a $1 replacement is quite a hassle. You have to send them your broken wire and a SASE envelope. If you need a slicer at all, buy one of those that offer replacement wires on Amazon. But using a good knife is definitely a much better idea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice cheese slicer for the price
customer_reviews.text: The wire is pretty durable, and it slices through hard and soft cheeses alike. The depression where the wire sits is a pain in the backside to clean, and cheese particles get caught in there after every slice.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Works but flawed
customer_reviews.text: My main complaint is that the cable frequently gets out of alignment with the channel. It can also be hard to clean. Overall however, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: da_cheat87

customer_reviews.title: There was a misalignment issue with the wire 'blade' but a comment in another review made that an easy fix. Had I gotten the ins
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item not for cutting cheese, but for cutting my soap logs. There was a misalignment issue with the wire 'blade' but a comment in another review made that an easy fix. Had I gotten the instruction sheet that I'm told was supposed to be included, I might have saved myself some consternation. The slicer itself appears to be reasonably well made and I'm sure it will cut cheese just fine. I tried it with a piece of my soap and it did cut it but not without some struggling. If you want a soap cutter, don't get this.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Soilwhisperer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, Durable Cheese Cutting Board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband. It is beautiful and slices through med cheddar cheese with ease. After use, be sure to clean out crumbs of cheese in the crack where the cutting wire sets. I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: treese

customer_reviews.title: Very surprised and very happy
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first as I have never bought a cheese board before. I have always just used a handheld slicer. But my girlfriend always has a hard time using a handheld so I bought this hoping it would help..and let me say I use this ALL the time now. It is the perfect size and the quality is nice and works great. So happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Lanham

customer_reviews.title: Slice cheese with ease! Our four year old loves to help slice and prepare our cheese plate.
customer_reviews.text: Slicing cheese has never been so simple—we should have purchased one years ago! This slicer will now be part of our “go-to gifts for newlyweds!”
customer_reviews.author: L. Humes

customer_reviews.title: Quality slicer at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to slice blocks of Muenster cheese. It's seen two blocks, about 13 pounds and 140 slices. Overall, this is a quality slicer. I don't have to stop and clean it on between slicing. I can keep going till the end without fail. Haven't needed to replace the wire and it's as tight as day one. The only reason, this far, to give 4 instead if 5 is the ease of cleaning. Cheese does tend to get in the nooks and crannies which can be difficult to get clean. If I'm still using it next year, it will get a 5th star for durability.
customer_reviews.author: LgFri

customer_reviews.title: Easy on the wrist
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I hated having to cut cheese with a knife as it crumbled and hurt my wrist. This product makes me excited to cut cheese. It is easy to use, easy on the wrist and the cheese does not crumble. So far I have cut cheddar, Colby and pepper jack. I only gave four stars because with the harder cheese (cheddar) the wire bends a bit more so does not fit perfectly in the groove like when I cut the softer cheeses. A slightly larger groove would fix this issue. Regardless though, it still cut the cheese nicely. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena A LaShomb

customer_reviews.title: Prodyne or use a knife!
customer_reviews.text: I am part owner in a couple wineries - think lots of cut cheese for the clients on the weekends. So I have used the slicer dicers of other brands. This is the one. Of course heed their wire replacement program, as I have sent back 2 wires to replace, but it's free! And it's easy to replace. And it lasted for many hours of cutting before someone misaligned the cut a few times and "hack". sigh. So I have 4 different styles now of Prodyne and they are great. I think the management at Prodyne has their customer service perfect.
customer_reviews.author: De Allison

product_meta.title: Prodyne Bamboo Cheese Slicer, 12" x 6"
product_meta.description: Style Name:BambooThis sleek board combines Dark and light Bamboo with a bright chrome slicing arm. Board measures 12-Inch by 6-Inch. Color box.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,037 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
